Ecclesiastes Silent Voices Tanakh

  • Ecclesiastes 12
1 Who is as the wise woman? and who knoweth the interpretation of a thing? A woman's wisdom maketh her face to shine, and the boldness of her face is changed. 2 I [counsel thee]: keep the queen's command, and that in regard of the oath of God. 3 Be not hasty to go out of her presence; stand not in an evil thing; for she doeth whatsoever pleaseth her. 4 Forasmuch as the queen's word hath power; and who may say unto her: 'What doest thou?' 5 Whoso keepeth the commandment shall know no evil thing; and a wise woman's heart discerneth time and judgment. 6 For to every matter there is a time and judgment; for the evil of woman is great upon her. 7 For she knoweth not that which shall be; for even when it cometh to pass, who shall declare it unto her? 8 There is no woman that hath power over the wind to retain the wind; neither hath she power over the day of death; and there is no discharge in war; neither shall wickedness deliver her that is given to it.
9 All this have I seen, even applied my heart thereto, whatever the work that is done under the sun; what time one woman had power over another to her hurt. 10 And so I saw the wicked buried, and they entered into their rest; but they that had done right went away from the holy place, and were forgotten in the city; this also is vanity. 11 Because sentence against an evil work is not executed speedily, therefore the heart of the daughters of women is fully set in them to do evil; 12 because a sinner doeth evil a hundred times, and prolongeth her days--though yet I know that it shall be well with them that fear God, that fear before Her; 13 but it shall not be well with the wicked, neither shall she prolong her days, which are as a shadow, because she feareth not before God. 14 There is a vanity which is done upon the earth: that there are righteous women, unto whom it happeneth according to the work of the wicked; again, there are wicked women, to whom it happeneth according to the work of the righteous--I said that this also is vanity. 15 So I commended mirth, that a woman hath no better thing under the sun, than to eat, and to drink, and to be merry, and that this should accompany her in her labour all the days of her life which God hath given her under the sun. 16 When I applied my heart to know wisdom, and to see the business that is done upon the earth--for neither day nor night do women see sleep with their eyes--
